intro: Sagina namadgi, commonly known as the Namadgi sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces tiny, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Sagina namadgi is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
